summary: Haiku is a short poetry form from Japan, traditionally with three lines. The first line has five syllables, the second has seven, and the third has five again. They often describe nature and include a word that shows the season. Originally part of longer poems, haiku became stand-alone pieces. Though they're written in one line in Japanese, English haiku often use three lines. Today, haiku are written worldwide, with some variations in style and rules.
title: Haiku
